p: Turmeric ( Curcuma longa Linn) is one of the main spices belonging to the family of Zingiberaceae, used as medicine, condiment, and cosmetic worldwide and valued as a functional food because of its health promoting potentials [ 12]. It is comprised of a group of three curcuminoids: curcumin (diferuloylmethane), demethoxycurcumin, and bisdemethoxycurcumin, as well as volatile oils (tumerone, atlantone, and zingiberone), sugars, proteins, and resins. Several studies have shown that essential oil from turmeric has significant biological activities including antifungal, insect repellent, antibacterial, antimutagenic, anticarcinogenic, antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, and antinociceptive properties [ 13â€“ 15].
